ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Comments about assessment
Describe peer.
How well did [name of peer] listen to your suggestions?
How open was [name of peer] to new ideas?
How helpful were [name of peer]'s suggestions?
How helpful did [name of peer] think your suggestions were?
How well did you work together?
How how much did you agree about what should go on the list?
How much does [name of peer] like the same [topic of list] as you?
Were there [topic of list] you liked but your partner didn't?
Were there [topic of list] you liked but your partner didn't? If so, which?
Were there [topic of list] your partner liked but you didn't?
Were there [topic of list] your partner liked but you didn't? If so, which?
[Name of peer] and I have similar interests.
[Name of peer] and I communicated well.
[Name of peer] understands my ideas, thoughts, and feelings.
I felt self-conscious when interacting with [name of peer].
I understand [name of peer]'s ideas, thoughts, and feelings.
[Name of peer] and I have similar views about many things.
I'm concerned about how [name of peer] perceives me.
[Name of peer] and I have a lot in common.
How well did you interaction with [name of peer] go overall?
How much did you enjoy your interaction overall?
How awkward did you feel when interacting with [name of peer]?
How much would you want to continue a friendship with [name of peer] outside of the lab?
How well does [name of peer] think your interaction went overall?
How much did [name of peer] enjoy your interaction overall?
How much would [name of peer] want to continue a friendship with you outside of the lab?
How nervous did you feel when intacting with [name of peer]?
How nervous did you feel when interacting with the experimenter?
Is there any feedback you want to give the researchers about your session today?
A global rating of rapport during conversation/interaction is determined from participants affect, conversation skills, echolalia, and eye contact.
Notes: 1 = Behaviors during interaction make it difficult for the peer to continue the interaction; does not flexibly modulate behaviors in response to peer. 2 = A few times when behaviors during interaction promote the continuation of the interaction, but mostly behaviors that make the interaction difficult to continue. 3 = Behaviors promoting the continuation of the interaction present about half the time. 4 = A few times when behaviors make the interaction difficult to continue, but mostly actions promoting the continuation of the interaction. 5 = Behaviors during interaction promote the continuation of the interaction; flexibly responding to peer.

ElementDescription: Rate social ease on 5-point scale, based on behaviors indicating comfort versus discomfort during the interaction.
Notes: 1=Appears uncomfortable during social interaction; displays anxious behavior most of the time; little to no spontaneous affect, 5=Displays comfort during social interaction, including flexible affect and no anxious behaviors.

ElementDescription: My friend could tell I really cared about them.
My friend felt happy about the interaction we just had.
My friend feels satisfied with our friendship.
I felt supported by my friend.
I felt better after talking to my friend about my problem.
